titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the David Rakoff Papers
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday January 22, 2019 at 05:45

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The collection consists of writings, correspondence, datebooks, notebooks, financial papers, photographs, artwork, rubber stamps, printed materials, audiovisual materials, and other papers by, to, or relating to David Rakoff. Writings include multiple drafts of Rakoff's essay collections Fraud , Don't Get Too Comfortable , and Half Empty .

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from David Rakoff on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, 2012.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 16 (film reels): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 17 (computer disks): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies of electronic files may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The David Rakoff Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: David Rakoff Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections as they are acquired, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.
This collection received a basic level of processing, including rehousing and minimal organization.

Information included in the Description of Papers note and Collection Contents section is drawn from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.

bioghist.head: David Rakoff (1964-2012)
bioghist.p: David Rakoff was a Canadian writer based in New York City known for humorous non-fiction essays and as a contributor to the radio program This American Life.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of writings, correspondence, datebooks, notebooks, financial papers, photographs, artwork, rubber stamps, printed materials, audiovisual materials, and other papers by, to, or relating to David Rakoff. Writings include multiple drafts of Rakoff's essay collections Fraud , Don't Get Too Comfortable , and Half Empty .

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into six series: I. Correspondence, 1949-2012. II. Writings, 1990s-2000s. III. Personal Papers, 1980s-2010s. IV. Printed Materials, 1990s-2008. V. Audiovisual Materials, 1980s. VI. Electronic Media, 2000s.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged chronologically. Materials previously intermixed with correspondence are grouped together following the correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material was tightly folded into a long U-shape.

did.unittitle: Writings by David Rakoff and others

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Writings include typescripts, corrected proofs, and galleys for works including Fraud , Don't Get Too Comfortable , and Half Empty . See also Series I. Correspondence.

did.unittitle: Articles and reviews - typescripts, some with edits
"David Rakoff - New Script" - 3 clean typescript copies, removed from binder, with blank application to Actors' Equity Association
Don't Get Too Comfortable - second draft, corrected, with comments by Kendra Harpoter (Doubleday)
Don't Get Too Comfortable - typescripts with notes, commentary and letter by Bill Thomas (Doubleday)
eine DATA base - NAM JUNE PAIK - edition cantz
Fraud: Essays - commentary and corrections from Pamela Murray
Fraud: Essays - miscellaneous TS pages with corrections
Fraud: Essays - typescript, first draft with edits and artwork
Half Empty - typescript with edits and commentary by Bill Thomas (Doubleday)
Little Freida Mysteries - typescript with highlighting, and rehearsal schedule
The Little Freida Mysteries - typescript with notes and highlighting
"March Drama Department Play" - rough draft and untitled script, removed from binder with clipping
Miscellaneous script pages - typescript with edits and highlighting
Pages from a script with highlighting and edits, removed from binder

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal appers include diaries and day planners, financial papers, photographs and slides, artwork, and rubber stamps. See also Series I. Correspondence.

did.unittitle: Blank notebook with journal entries, sketches, miscellaneous inserts
Personal notebook - "Tokyo, Iceland, Aspen, Loch Ness..."
Don't Get Too Comfortable - publication agreement
Fraud - Financial papers and related correspondence
"Backstage Press" tag and receipts - [Removed from photographs]
Correspondence and ephemera related to photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Originally tied around the rubber stamps.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Printed materials include various New York periodicals and clippings of theatre reviews. See also Series I. Correspondence.

did.unittitle: The New York Times and Observatory
The New York Times - two copies
The New York Times Book Review- Paperback Best Sellers - Framed

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

scopecontent.p: Includes CDs, DVDs and an external hard drive.
